name: Hilton Grand Vacations Suites - Las Vegas (Convention Center)

reviews.text: I love this hotel in Vegas. No casino! Not on the strip! Yeah! It's quiet and the suite rooms have everything. If you're going to Vegas for business or for other than gambling/partying, this is a great option. Best if you have a rental car to get around, although it is on the monorail. The pool is small, but nicely appointed with an outdoor bar. The hotel has no restaurant so you either have to eat out or can prepare your own dinner in the kitchenette which is fully furnished. The Albertson's supermarket is nearby.
reviews.title: Hilton Grand Vacations Suites

reviews.text: The key: Get one of the upgraded suites with a huge hot tub in it. Divine. Huge bathroom. Good internet speeds.
reviews.title: WOW!!!!!!

reviews.text: If you want to party and walk up and down the strip, this is not the hotel for you. No room service either.
reviews.title: A clean, quiet place in Las Vegas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Absolutely blown away at the room! We had a 1Bedroom suite with Jacuzzi, full kitchen with cool black appliances, 2 TV's which is great with kids, and a fantastic view of the stratosphere tower. Hotel is a 5 min walk to LVH monorail terminal...staff super helpful and friendly......only wish they had bell serrvices or atleast luggage racks available. Would stay again in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: Good experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently spent a week at this hotel in Las Vegas, a city that we enjoy visiting but are often hesitant because we don't want to spend our nights listening to rowdy drunks and partyers in the adjoining hallways and guestrooms. The Hilton Grand Vacation Suites was the answer to all of our concerns. The facility is very clean, the rooms are large and well appointed, there is no casino or bars on the property so the party crowd tends to stay elsewhere. It is off the strip, which also helps, but is just a five minute walk from the Las Vegas Hilton (now the LVH hotel and casino) monorail station. Also, NO resort fees, free in room internet access and free covered parking. This place is the best place to stay in Vegas and we will always be staying there on return trips. The rates are extremely reasonable also...we paid about $100 per night for a July trip.
reviews.title: Beyond the Hilton

reviews.text: Well, this is a "time share" hotel, so don't expect a casino or even a restaurant, however, they have the most accomodating and helpful staff as anywhere I have stayed. There is a nice (but small by LV standards) pool, free parking, a deli with the nicest people (wish I could say as much for the food), outdoor bar and a cool TV room where you can watch movies. I stayed here because it is close to the convention center..... BUT it's a good mile or so away, so if you plan on walking, wear comfortable shoes! The front desk personnel was very helpful, but want to give specific kudos to Karen - as tired and grouchy as I was upon check-in, she was patient, professional and accomodating. BTW, this is a totally non smoking facility - BUT, beware, people still smoke out in the patio......
reviews.title: Most accommodating staff

reviews.text: (Hi, I'm Southpaw6's 12-year-old daughter, and I'm going to be writing this review).
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good with families

reviews.text: I liked this hotel a lot. We rented a one-bedroom suite. It had a kitchenette attached to a living room with a couch-bed, a bedroom with a tub in it (which was sort of odd), and, of course, a bathroom. I liked that the kitchenette came with silverware and plates and stuff you could use. When we checked in wehung out for a while and took advantage of the two TVs (a great feature). We then checked out the pool, where you could rent towels and noodles for free. The pool was just the right depth and just the right temerature. I think the it was my favorite part of the hotel. The Hilton Grand Vacation Suites was conveniently located near Circus Circus, home of the AdventureDome theme park (a great theme park by the way), and a CVS.
reviews.title: Watch out for cockroaches

reviews.text: Okay, on to the sleeping/hygine conditions. The beds were about average. The cutains were thick and blocked out the light in the morning, so you didn't wake up too early. The bathroom was okay, except the shower wasn't very good. Apparently, the temperature control handle was also the water pressure control handle, so if you wanted decent pressure the water was scalding hot.
reviews.title: Convenience and quiet

reviews.text: Now, the safety/quietness conditions. The safe included in the closet was cool and kept all of our belongings hidden. Quietness? Well, our suite was far away from the elevator and we were on the 16th floor, so it was pretty quiet.
reviews.title: Very comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We swapped a timeshare to visit - our 2nd time at this resort - and it didnt disappoint. The staff were very polite and friendly. The front desk was well knowledged and helpful. The snack bar was to a high standard of food and service. Very lively free broadband - good selection of TV programmes - a dvd in room also with a small library of dvds available. Quite noisy around the pool this time - uneccessary music, some housekeeping crashing around and incessant chatter on and off phones from one group. No casino on site - but right next door to main Hilton - now known as LVH.
reviews.title: A great stay - large well-equipped room

reviews.text: The cabs seemed very expensive this time - there seemed to be a lot of tariff hopping.
reviews.title: Clean, Comfortable and Convenient.
Wonderful
reviews.text: Deuce bus was good value but slow and crowded - doesnt have stops convenient for all places.

In town on a 7 day business trip I stayed at the Hilton Grand Vacation Suites. In years past, had stayed in the Las Vegas Hilton. Now that it has changed hands and become quite a dump, I opted for the Grand Vacation Resort. Rooms here were fabulous and staff amazingly kind and professional. After a 8 hour day of standing on a trade show floor, it was a welcome experience to come back to a quiet and smoke free environment. No restaurants, no gaming. So nice.
reviews.title: The fact that I couldn't find it didn't help my first impression, but otherwise good.

reviews.text: My room was a one bedroom suite, king bed and huge bathroom. It was awesome to have a washer and dryer and full well supplied kitchen.
reviews.title: Good Comfortable and Quiet
What a perfect weekend!
reviews.text: Slightly biased by being a Hilton Gold member and therefore enjoying free breakfast and access to the spa and gym I absolutely loved the hotel. Away from the center, but within easy reach by public transport, the hotel was the perfect location for our weekend. Staff was very nice and the rooms absolutely fit for purpose, not that we would have spent too much time there...
Would always come back for another weekend!
reviews.title: My new favorite hotel for attending Vegas conventions

reviews.text: I have been attending an annual trade show hosted at the main Hilton hotel in Vegas for 8 years. After seeing the quality of the hotel go down I decided to search out an alternative. My search criteria started with free wifi, since that is a pet peeve of mine having to pay $15/day at the hilton for wifi. I discovered the Grand Vacations and was surprised to find it next door to the Vegas Hilton, but newer, nicer and cheaper (with free wifi).
reviews.title: Just okay, not sure I would go again

reviews.text: Since I am not a gambler, the bonus was finding out it's a non casino hotel, so I made the booking. Several days later I got an email about an upgrade offer for a suite for only $17 if available ( to be confirmed on checkin). I put my name down, and upon arrival, was upgraded to a spacious suite.
reviews.title: Thoroughly Enjoyed Stay

reviews.text: The suite was about 750sq ft, with a full kitchen (stove/fridge/microwave), large sitting area with sofa, chairs as well as a dining table. Separate bedroom with ensuite, with both a shower stall and a large soaker tub. Being 6'4, I couldn't wait to try out the sofa tub.
reviews.title: My trip home

aka: Hilton Grand Vacations Suites - Las Vegas (Convention Center) Hotel
description: Hilton Grand Vacations Suites - Las Vegas (Convention Center) is adjacent to the Las Vegas Hilton, the Las Vegas Convention Center and minutes from the fabulous Las Vegas Strip where the shopping and entertainment never stop, plus convenient to the I-15 Freeway and a Las Vegas Monorail Station. Guests of this resort enjoy elegantly appointed studios and one & two-bedroom suites with views of the Las Vegas Country Club Golf Course and the Las Vegas Strip.
